H0.text: What is the name of the whirlpool in the Hebrides between Scarba and Jura, the third largest in the world. Garvellachs Maelstrom

H1.text: What is the name of the whirlpool in the Hebrides between Scarba and Jura, the third largest in the world. Scarba Vortex

H2.text: What is the name of the whirlpool in the Hebrides between Scarba and Jura, the third largest in the world. Jura Strait Whirlpool

H3.text: What is the name of the whirlpool in the Hebrides between Scarba and Jura, the third largest in the world. Corryvreckan

A4.text: The Corryvreckan is the third largest whirlpool in the world, and is on the northern side of the gulf, surrounding a pyramid-shaped basalt pinnacle that rises from depths of 70 to 29 m (230 to 95 ft) at its rounded top.

A5.text: The Gulf of Corryvreckan (from the Gaelic Coire Bhreacain, meaning 'cauldron of the speckled seas' or 'cauldron of the plaid'), also called the Strait of Corryvreckan, is a narrow strait between the islands of Jura and Scarba, in Argyll and Bute, off the west coast of mainland Scotland.
